alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 29 at 2:37AM MST until January 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of one to three feet, with locally higher amounts possible in the upper Cottonwoods by Monday morning. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs and Central Mountains. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through late Sunday night. The hazardous conditions could impact peak weekend and holiday travel along mountain routes. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This long duration event will feature periods of very heavy snowfall along with brief breaks in precipitation. A rain-snow mix is possible at times below 6800 ft, especially during the day on Saturday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
